overview: This file controls global parameters for game rules and how they work between each difficulty mode Users cannot add new difficulty modes from this file  Any column field name starting with “*” is considered a comment field and is not used by the game

data_fields.name: Name
data_fields.description: This is a reference field to define the difficulty mode

data_fields.name: ResistPenalty
data_fields.description: Defines the baseline starting point for a player character’s resistances for Expansion mode

data_fields.name: ResistPenaltyNonExpansion
data_fields.description: Defines the baseline starting point for a player character’s resistances for Non-Expansion mode

data_fields.name: DeathExpPenalty
data_fields.description: Modifies the percentage of current level experience lost when a player character dies

data_fields.name: MonsterSkillBonus
data_fields.description: Adds additional skill levels to skills used by monsters (defined from monstats.txt)

data_fields.name: MonsterFreezeDivisor
data_fields.description: Divisor that affects all Freeze Length values on monsters. The attempted Freeze Length value is divided by this divisor to determine the actual Freeze Length.

data_fields.name: MonsterColdDivisor
data_fields.description: Divisor that affects all Cold Length values on monsters. The attempted Cold Length value is divided by this divisor to determine the actual Cold Length.

data_fields.name: AiCurseDivisor
data_fields.description: Divisor that affects all durations of Curses on monsters. The attempted Curse duration is divided by this divisor to determine the actual Curse duration.

data_fields.name: LifeStealDivisor
data_fields.description: Divisor that affects the amount of Life Steal that player characters gain. The attempted Life Steal value is divided by this divisor to determine the actual Life Steal.

data_fields.name: ManaStealDivisor
data_fields.description: Divisor that affects the amount of Mana Steal that player characters gain. The attempted Mana Steal value is divided by this divisor to determine the actual Mana Steal.

data_fields.name: UniqueDamageBonus
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for a Unique monster’s overall Damage and Attack Rating. This is applied after calculating the monster’s other modifications.

data_fields.name: ChampionDamageBonus
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for a Champion monster’s overall Damage and Attack Rating. This is applied after calculating the monster’s other modifications.

data_fields.name: PlayerDamagePercentVSPlayer
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player deals to another player

data_fields.name: PlayerDamagePercentVSMercenary
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player deals to another player’s mercenary

data_fields.name: PlayerDamagePercentVSPrimeEvil
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player deals to a Prime Evil boss PlayerHitReactBufferVSPlayer – The frame length for the amount of time a player cannot be placed into another hit react from a player (25 frames = 1 second).

data_fields.name: PlayerHitReactBufferVSMonster
data_fields.description: The frame length for the amount of time a player cannot be placed into another hit react from a monster (25 frames = 1 second).

data_fields.name: MercenaryDamagePercentVSPlayer
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player’s mercenary deals to another player

data_fields.name: MercenaryDamagePercentVSMercenary
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player’s mercenary deals to another player’s mercenary

data_fields.name: MercenaryDamagePercentVSBoss
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player’s mercenary deals to a boss monster

data_fields.name: MercenaryMaxStunLength
data_fields.description: The frame length for the maximum stun length allowed on a player’s mercenary (25 Frames = 1 second)

data_fields.name: PrimeEvilDamagePercentVSPlayer
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier applied to the total damage a Prime Evil boss deals to a player

data_fields.name: PrimeEvilDamagePercentVSMercenary
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a Prime Evil boss deals to a player’s mercenary

data_fields.name: PrimeEvilDamagePercentVSPet
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a Prime Evil boss deals to a player’s pet

data_fields.name: PetDamagePercentVSPlayer
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for the total damage a player’s pet deals to another player

data_fields.name: MonsterCEDamagePercent
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier that affects how much damage is dealt to a player by a Monster’s version of Corpse Explosion. For example, when certain monsters die and explode on death.

data_fields.name: MonsterFireEnchantExplosionDamagePercent
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier that affects how much damage is dealt to a player by a Monster’s Fire Enchant explosion. The Fire Enchant death explosion uses the same Corpse Explosion functionality and this value is applied after the “MonsterCEDamagePercent” value.

data_fields.name: StaticFieldMin
data_fields.description: Percentage modifier for capping the amount of current Life damage dealt to monsters by the Sorceress Static Field skill. This field only affects games in Expansion mode.

data_fields.name: GambleRare
data_fields.description: The odds to obtain a Rare item from gambling. The game rolls a random number between 0 to 100000. If that rolled number is less than this value, then the gambled item will be a Rare item.

data_fields.name: GambleSet
data_fields.description: The odds to obtain a Set item from gambling. The game rolls a random number between 0 to 100000. If that rolled number is less than this value, then the gambled item will be a Set item.

data_fields.name: GambleUnique
data_fields.description: The odds to obtain a Unique item from gambling. The game rolls a random number between 0 to 100000. If that rolled number is less than this value, then the gambled item will be a Unique item.

data_fields.name: GambleUber
data_fields.description: The odds to make the gambled item be an Exceptional Quality item. The game rolls a random number between 0 to 10000. This rolled number is then compared to the following formula:

data_fields.name: ([Item Level]
data_fields.description: [Base Item Level]) * [“GambleUber”] + 1. If the rolled number is less than this value, then the item becomes an Exceptional Quality item, and the game will roll for upgrading it to Elite Quality (See “GambleUltra”).

data_fields.name: GambleUltra
data_fields.description: The odds to make the gambled item be an Elite Quality item. The game rolls a random number between 0 to 10000. This rolled number is then compared to the following formula:

data_fields.name: ([Item Level]
data_fields.description: [Base Item Level]) * [“GambleUltra”] + 1. If the rolled number is less than this value, then the item is upgraded to an Elite Quality item. This only happens if the item successfully rolled for Exceptional Quality.
